name: Trevor Crosby, Ph.D.
label: Data & Machine Learning Scientist
summary: AI/ML leader with experience building production-grade machine learning systems to solve complex challenges at scale.

highlights: In my current role at John Deere, I develop advanced data processing and machine learning tools that help connect and compare complex multimodal data like images, sensor readings, and text. My focus is on low-latency comparison systems, creating novel embedding piplines for high-complexity data, and streamlining workflows with AI-powered tools. I lead many technical efforts, develop products from ideation to deployment, and mentor newer team members.

At Corteva, I created AI/ML tools to support customer decision-making, using geospatial, environmental, and biological data to predict outcomes like crop pest dynamics and yield quality. I also helped develop a personalized recommendation system to guide product choices based on product features, regional factors, and customer profiles. I focused on full-pipeline development—from raw data through deployed product—while collaborating across teams to ensure scalability and usability.

During my Ph.D., I led research at the intersection of remote sensing, machine learning, and crop science. I worked with hyperspectral and multispectral imagery to design predictive models that helped local farmers rapidly respond to spatio-temporally variable factors impacting their crop's yield, quality, and fertility throughout the growing season.My academic work laid the foundation for my applied ML skills and strengthened my ability to lead, teach, and communicate across disciplines.

volunteer_experience.summary: As an organizer for Seattle Data Professionals, I lead biweekly meetups focused on connecting local scientists, engineers, and analysts in the data and machine learning field. I help grow the community and encourage knowledge sharing, career development, and meaningful connections.

As a guest lecturer for Seattle SDE Skills, I deliver interactive whiteboarding sessions on core topics in machine learning, data science, and software engineering. Some of my previous talks include a deep dive into gradient descent, an introduction to SQL fundamentals, and an applied walkthrough of graph algorithms.

degrees: Bachelor of Science in Plant Science
Minor in Management and Sales in Agribusiness

skills.name: Python, SQL, Git, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Spark, Databricks, GenAI, LLMs, CVML, Vector Databases, CI/CD, Agile
